crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
When checking on the overall status of the existence of HTTP ($_GET or $_POST) data, the issetHTTP() method of the http_manager :: class will return TRUE or FALSE depending on the existence of data in the request method type. This method accepts a single parameter...the $_GET or $_POST super global.
For a more granular approach to determining the availability of specific parameters received through either the $_POST or $_GET method, the issetParam() method of the http_manager :: class will return TRUE or FALSE depending on the availability of specified parameters within the specified HTTP request method type ($_GET or $_POST).
The issetParam() method...which is being documented here...requires one additional parameter...the $name of the variable that is being tested for existence in the specified super global.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an Ubuntu Server 16.04 running PHP 7.0.22 and Redhat Linux running PHP 5.5.38.

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: The name of the variable within the specified HTTP request method that needs to have its data extracted from the respective super global.
The $_POST or $_GET super global of the HTTP request method containing the data that is to be extracted.
